an6.76:4.1: “Mendicants, without giving up six things you can’t realize perfection.
an6.76:4.3: Conceit, inferiority complex, superiority complex, overestimation, obstinacy, and grovelling.
an6.76:4.4: Without giving up these six qualities you can’t realize perfection.
an6.76:5.1: After giving up six things you can realize perfection.
an6.76:5.3: Conceit, inferiority complex, superiority complex, overestimation, obstinacy, and grovelling.
an6.76:5.4: After giving up these six things you can realize the fruit of perfection.”
